<ce:figure id="f0005">
<ce:label>Fig. 1</ce:label>
<ce:caption>
<ce:simple-para id="sp025" view="all">(a) Coordination environment of Cd(II) atom in <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> with ellipsoids drawn at the 30% probability level, hydrogen atoms, perchlorate anions and free water molecules were omitted for clarity. (b) 2D network of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> linked by C–H⋯O hydrogen bonds indicated by dashed lines.</ce:simple-para>
</ce:caption>
<ce:link locator="gr1"></ce:link>
</ce:figure>

elements.clean_text:
Graphical abstract

Four new coordination complexes with N,N'-di(pyridin-3-yl)pyridine-3,5-dicarboxamide have been synthesized and structurally characterized. The complexes show 1D chain, (6,3) 2D network and 3D framework structures. The Luminescence of the complexes was investigated.

<ce:section-title>Highlights</ce:section-title><ce:simple-para id="sp010" view="all">► Coordination polymers with <ce:italic>N</ce:italic>,<ce:italic>N</ce:italic>′-di(pyridin-3-yl)pyridine-3,5-dicarboxamide. ► Complexes with 1D chain, 2D network and 3D framework structures. ► Luminescence of the complexes.</ce:simple-para><ce:section-title>Abstract</ce:section-title><ce:simple-para id="sp015" view="all">Four new coordination complexes [Cd(DPBA-3)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>](ClO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>), [Cd(DPBA-3)(DMF)(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>]·DMF (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>), [Cd<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>(DPBA-3)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(SCN)<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>]·2DMF·4H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>) and [Zn(DPBA-3)(SCN)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>4</ce:bold>) [DPBA-3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>
<ce:italic>N</ce:italic>,<ce:italic>N</ce:italic>′-di(pyridin-3-yl)pyridine-3,5-dicarboxamide] have been synthesized and characterized by elemental analysis, IR and single crystal X-ray diffraction. Complexes <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>, <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> and <ce:bold>4</ce:bold> exhibit three different types of one-dimensional (1D) chain structures constructed by the metal ions and DPBA-3 ligands, and the Cd(II)-DPBA-3 1D chains in <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> are further linked by bridging SCN<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup> ligands to afford a three-dimensional (3D) framework. Complex <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> possesses a (6,3) two-dimensional (2D) layer structure. In <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>–<ce:bold>4</ce:bold>, the hydrogen bonds involving the amide groups play important role to stabilize the resultant frameworks. The photoluminescence properties of the DPBA-3 and the complexes were studied in the solid state at room temperature.</ce:simple-para>
elements.clean_text:
Highlights

► Coordination polymers with N,N'-di(pyridin-3-yl)pyridine-3,5-dicarboxamide. ► Complexes with 1D chain, 2D network and 3D framework structures. ► Luminescence of the complexes.

Abstract

Four new coordination complexes [Cd(DPBA-3)2(H2O)2](ClO4)2⋅2H2O (1), [Cd(DPBA-3)(DMF)(NO3)2]⋅DMF (2), [Cd3(DPBA-3)2(SCN)6]⋅2DMF⋅4H2O (3) and [Zn(DPBA-3)(SCN)2] (4) [DPBA-3= N,N'-di(pyridin-3-yl)pyridine-3,5-dicarboxamide] have been synthesized and characterized by elemental analysis, IR and single crystal X-ray diffraction. Complexes 1, 3 and 4 exhibit three different types of one-dimensional (1D) chain structures constructed by the metal ions and DPBA-3 ligands, and the Cd(II)-DPBA-3 1D chains in 3 are further linked by bridging SCN- ligands to afford a three-dimensional (3D) framework. Complex 2 possesses a (6,3) two-dimensional (2D) layer structure. In 1-4, the hydrogen bonds involving the amide groups play important role to stabilize the resultant frameworks. The photoluminescence properties of the DPBA-3 and the complexes were studied in the solid state at room temperature.

elements.content: <ce:section-title>Introduction</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0005" view="all">Coordination polymers containing transition metal centers and organic bridging ligands have been rapidly developed in recent years because of their fascinating structures and potential applications as functional materials in electronic, magnetic, optical and catalytic fields . One key step in building coordination polymers is to rational design the ligand and to choose metal salts with suitable coordination geometry. On the other hand, coordination interactions between transition metal centers and multidentate organic ligands lead to the formation of primary structure, which can be further organized to supramolecular structures through non-covalent interactions, such as hydrogen bonding and π–π interactions . In this respect, pyridinylcarboxamides represent a particularly interesting class of ligands since such simple building unit contains multiple binding sites for the weak interactions . We have previously demonstrated that the tri-pyridinylamide derivative of 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid was able to generate helical columnar aggregates due to threefold helical-type intermolecular hydrogen bonding and π–π stacking interactions .</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
Introduction

Coordination polymers containing transition metal centers and organic bridging ligands have been rapidly developed in recent years because of their fascinating structures and potential applications as functional materials in electronic, magnetic, optical and catalytic fields . One key step in building coordination polymers is to rational design the ligand and to choose metal salts with suitable coordination geometry. On the other hand, coordination interactions between transition metal centers and multidentate organic ligands lead to the formation of primary structure, which can be further organized to supramolecular structures through non-covalent interactions, such as hydrogen bonding and π-π interactions . In this respect, pyridinylcarboxamides represent a particularly interesting class of ligands since such simple building unit contains multiple binding sites for the weak interactions . We have previously demonstrated that the tri-pyridinylamide derivative of 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid was able to generate helical columnar aggregates due to threefold helical-type intermolecular hydrogen bonding and π-π stacking interactions .

elements.content: <ce:para id="p0010" view="all">The self-assembly process of coordination polymer can also be influenced by some subtle effects (reaction temperature, solvent, et al.), and counterions may show coligand effects. For example, thiocyanate anion has extraordinary varieties in the binding of complexes and shows great potential in building coordination frameworks. It can adopt end-on and end-to-end fashions via the nitrogen and sulfur atoms to bind metal ions. In particular, the end-to-end bridging fashion increases the dimensionality of the coordination network by the interlinking of the 1D chains or 2D networks, and meantime it enhances the interactions between paramagnetic metal-ions. It is worthy to note that cadmium thiocyanate adducts of organic ligands are an important class of complexes for the design and preparation of functional coordination frameworks since Cd(II) ion can form stable double SCN bridged chains .</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: The self-assembly process of coordination polymer can also be influenced by some subtle effects (reaction temperature, solvent, et al.), and counterions may show coligand effects. For example, thiocyanate anion has extraordinary varieties in the binding of complexes and shows great potential in building coordination frameworks. It can adopt end-on and end-to-end fashions via the nitrogen and sulfur atoms to bind metal ions. In particular, the end-to-end bridging fashion increases the dimensionality of the coordination network by the interlinking of the 1D chains or 2D networks, and meantime it enhances the interactions between paramagnetic metal-ions. It is worthy to note that cadmium thiocyanate adducts of organic ligands are an important class of complexes for the design and preparation of functional coordination frameworks since Cd(II) ion can form stable double SCN bridged chains .

elements.content:
<ce:para id="p0015" view="all">Continuing our interest in the construction of coordination polymers containing pyridinylcarboxamides and thiocyanate anions, we have used the known ligand <ce:italic>N</ce:italic>,<ce:italic>N</ce:italic>′-di(pyridin-3-yl)pyridine-3,5-dicarboxamide (DPBA-3) (Scheme S1) to probe the formation of supramolecular structures. The relative flexibility of DPBA-3 ligand may make the coligand effects of thiocyanate possible and facilitates the formation of high dimensional architectures. The metal ions with <ce:italic>d</ce:italic>
<ce:sup loc="post">10</ce:sup> configuration, for example Zn<ce:sup loc="post">2+</ce:sup> and Cd<ce:sup loc="post">2+</ce:sup>, usually have potential application in optical areas, such as fluorescence probe and nonlinear optical materials . Herein, we report the syntheses, structures and photoluminescence of four complexes, [Cd(DPBA-3)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>](ClO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>), [Cd(DPBA-3)(DMF)(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>]·DMF (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>), [Cd<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>(DPBA-3)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(SCN)<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>]·2DMF·4H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>) and [Zn(DPBA-3)(SCN)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>4</ce:bold>).</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: Continuing our interest in the construction of coordination polymers containing pyridinylcarboxamides and thiocyanate anions, we have used the known ligand N,N'-di(pyridin-3-yl)pyridine-3,5-dicarboxamide (DPBA-3) (Scheme S1) to probe the formation of supramolecular structures. The relative flexibility of DPBA-3 ligand may make the coligand effects of thiocyanate possible and facilitates the formation of high dimensional architectures. The metal ions with d 10 configuration, for example Zn2+ and Cd2+, usually have potential application in optical areas, such as fluorescence probe and nonlinear optical materials . Herein, we report the syntheses, structures and photoluminescence of four complexes, [Cd(DPBA-3)2(H2O)2](ClO4)2⋅2H2O (1), [Cd(DPBA-3)(DMF)(NO3)2]⋅DMF (2), [Cd3(DPBA-3)2(SCN)6]⋅2DMF⋅4H2O (3) and [Zn(DPBA-3)(SCN)2] (4).

elements.content: <ce:section-title>Experimental</ce:section-title><ce:section-title>Materials and measurements</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0020" view="all">All chemicals are of reagent grade obtained from commercial sources and used without further purification. Solvents of dichloromethane (CH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>Cl<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>), methanol (MeOH), ethanol (EtOH), <ce:italic>N</ce:italic>,<ce:italic>N</ce:italic>-dimethylformamide (DMF), acetonitrile (MeCN), etc. were purified according to the standard methods. Ligand DPBA-3 was prepared according to the literature method . Elemental analyses of C, H and N were made on a Perkin-Elmer 240C Elemental Analyzer at the Analysis Center of Nanjing University. Infrared (IR) spectra were recorded on a Bruker Vector 22 FT-IR spectrophotometer by using KBr pellets. The luminescent spectra for the solid samples were recorded at room temperature on an Aminco Bowman Series 2 spectrophotometer with a xenon arc lamp as the light source. In the measurements of the emission and excitation spectra, the pass width is 5.0<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>nm. All the measurements were carried out under the same conditions.</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
Experimental

Materials and measurements

All chemicals are of reagent grade obtained from commercial sources and used without further purification. Solvents of dichloromethane (CH2Cl2), methanol (MeOH), ethanol (EtOH), N,N-dimethylformamide (DMF), acetonitrile (MeCN), etc. were purified according to the standard methods. Ligand DPBA-3 was prepared according to the literature method . Elemental analyses of C, H and N were made on a Perkin-Elmer 240C Elemental Analyzer at the Analysis Center of Nanjing University. Infrared (IR) spectra were recorded on a Bruker Vector 22 FT-IR spectrophotometer by using KBr pellets. The luminescent spectra for the solid samples were recorded at room temperature on an Aminco Bowman Series 2 spectrophotometer with a xenon arc lamp as the light source. In the measurements of the emission and excitation spectra, the pass width is 5.0nm. All the measurements were carried out under the same conditions.

elements.content: <ce:section-title>Synthesis of the complexes</ce:section-title><ce:section-title>Preparation of [Cd(DPBA-3)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>](ClO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0025" view="all">A mixture containing Cd(ClO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (21<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 0.05<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), DPBA-3 (16<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 0.05<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O and 1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml EtOH was sealed in a Teflon lined stainless steel container and heated at 85<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for 3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>days. After cooling to room temperature, the solution was filtered into the tube. After several days, colorless block crystals were obtained by the slow diffusion of diethyl ether into the reaction solution. Yield: 64%. <ce:italic>Anal.</ce:italic> Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">34</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">34</ce:inf>CdCl<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">10</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">16</ce:inf>: C, 39.96; H, 3.35; N, 13.71. Found: C, 40.02; H, 3.46; N, 13.81%. IR (KBr pellet, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3418 (s), 1669 (s), 1673 (m), 1548 (m), 1484 (m), 1424 (m), 1335 (w), 1294 (m), 1246 (w), 1093 (s), 1026 (s), 953 (w), 807 (w), 706 (w), 626 (w).</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
Synthesis of the complexes

Preparation of [Cd(DPBA-3)2(H2O)2](ClO4)2⋅2H2O (1)

A mixture containing Cd(ClO4)2⋅6H2O (21mg, 0.05mmol), DPBA-3 (16mg, 0.05mmol), 10ml H2O and 1ml EtOH was sealed in a Teflon lined stainless steel container and heated at 85°C for 3days. After cooling to room temperature, the solution was filtered into the tube. After several days, colorless block crystals were obtained by the slow diffusion of diethyl ether into the reaction solution. Yield: 64%. Anal. Calc. for C34H34CdCl2N10O16: C, 39.96; H, 3.35; N, 13.71. Found: C, 40.02; H, 3.46; N, 13.81%. IR (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3418 (s), 1669 (s), 1673 (m), 1548 (m), 1484 (m), 1424 (m), 1335 (w), 1294 (m), 1246 (w), 1093 (s), 1026 (s), 953 (w), 807 (w), 706 (w), 626 (w).

A buffer layer of a THF/DMF 1:1 solution (5mL) containing NH4SCN (7.6mg, 0.1mmol) was carefully layered over a solution of DPBA-3 (16.0mg, 0.05mmol) in THF (3mL). elements.clean_text:
X-ray crystallography

The crystallographic data collections for 1-4 were carried out on a Bruker Smart Apex CCD area-detector diffractometer with graphite-monochromated Mo Kα radiation (λ =0.71073Å) at 293(2) K using ω-scan technique. The diffraction data were integrated by using the saint program , which was also used for the intensity corrections for the Lorentz and polarization effects. Semi-empirical absorption correction was applied using the sadabs program . The structures were solved by direct methods and all the non-hydrogen atoms were refined anisotropically on F 2 by the full-matrix least-squares technique using the shelxl-97 crystallographic software package . All the hydrogen atoms except for those of water molecules were generated geometrically and refined isotropically using the riding model. The hydrogen atoms of free water molecules in 1 and 3 were not found while those of coordinated water molecules in 1 were located directly from the difference Fourier map. The details of the crystal parameters, data collection and refinements for the complexes are summarized in  , and selected bond lengths and angles with their estimated standard deviations are listed in  .

elements.clean_text:
Results and discussion

Description of the crystal structures of complexes 1-4 

[Cd(DPBA-3)2(H2O)2](ClO4)2⋅2H2O (1)

The results of crystallographic analysis revealed that the asymmetric unit of complex 1 consists of one Cd(II) ion located at a specific position, one DPBA-3 ligand, one coordinated and one non-coordinated water molecules, one perchlorate anion. As shown in  a, the Cd(II) is six-coordinated with distorted octahedral coordination geometry by two oxygen atoms (O7, O7C) from two water molecules and four nitrogen atoms (N1A, N1B, N5, N5C) from four different DPBA-3 ligands. The Cd1-O distance is of 2.320(2)Å and the Cd1-N ones are 2.352(3) and 2.357(3)Å (). In 1 each terminal pyridine unit (N1 and N5) of the DPBA-3 ligand coordinated to one metal ion, while the central pyridine unit (N3) is free of coordination. Thus each DPBA-3 serves as a bi-dentate ligand. In complex 1 two Cd(II) and two DPBA-3 are connected together via the Cd-N coordination bonds to form an Cd2(DPBA-3)2 macrocyclic ring with a Cd⋯Cd distance of 12.4269(48)Å. Such macrocyclic rings are further linked together to give an infinite 1D chain structure along c direction (Fig. S1a), which is further linked by C2-H2⋯O2 hydrogen bond between the amide CO and the C-H from an adjacent pyridine end group to afford 2D network in bc plane (b). In the crystal packing diagram of complex 1, such 2D networks are held together via hydrogen bonds to generate a 3D structure. The perchlorate anions are located in the cavities of the 3D framework (Fig. S1b). The hydrogen bonding data are summarized in  .

As shown in 
<ce:float-anchor refid="f0010"></ce:float-anchor>a, the central Cd(II) atom is seven-coordinated with distorted pentagonal bipyramid geometry by three oxygen atoms (O4, O7 and O8) from two different nitrate anions, one oxygen atom (O3) from a DMF and three nitrogen atoms (N1, N3B, N5A) from three distinct DPBA-3 ligands. The atoms N1 and N3B occupy the apical positions of the pentagonal bipyramid and the other five coordinating atoms form the basal plane. It is noteworthy that the two nitrate ions in <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> have different coordination modes: one is <ce:italic>μ</ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">1</ce:inf>-<ce:italic>η</ce:italic>
<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>:<ce:italic>η</ce:italic>
<ce:sup loc="post">0</ce:sup>-monodentate and the other one is <ce:italic>μ</ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">1</ce:inf>-<ce:italic>η</ce:italic>
<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>:<ce:italic>η</ce:italic>
<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>-chelate. The Cd1–N bond distances are ranging from 2.328(5) to 2.450(5)<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å with the N–Cd–N bond angles varying from 79.9(2) to 160.9(2). The Cd1–O bond distances are ranging from 2.313(5) to 2.631(7)<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å with the O–Cd–O bond angles varying from 49.2(2) to 163.2(2) (). In <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> all three pyridine units of each DPBA-3 participate the coordination with Cd(II) atoms; while in <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> only two pyridine units in one DPBA-3 ligand take part in the coordination with the metal atoms. In <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> each DPBA-3 bridges three Cd(II) atoms to form a 2D structure (b). If both DPBA-3 ligand and Cd1 atom are considered as 3-connected nodes, the 2D layer can be simplified into a (6,3) net  as shown in Fig. S2a. The adjacent 2D layers are linked together by N–H⋯O hydrogen bonds between amide function groups and the nitrate anions to generate a 3D structure (Fig. S2b and ).</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
[Cd(DPBA-3)(DMF)(NO3)2]⋅DMF (2)

Crystallographic analysis revealed that the asymmetric unit of complex 2 consists of one Cd(II) ion, one DPBA-3 ligand, two nitrate, one coordinated and one non-coordinated DMF molecules. As shown in  a, the central Cd(II) atom is seven-coordinated with distorted pentagonal bipyramid geometry by three oxygen atoms (O4, O7 and O8) from two different nitrate anions, one oxygen atom (O3) from a DMF and three nitrogen atoms (N1, N3B, N5A) from three distinct DPBA-3 ligands. The atoms N1 and N3B occupy the apical positions of the pentagonal bipyramid and the other five coordinating atoms form the basal plane. It is noteworthy that the two nitrate ions in 2 have different coordination modes: one is μ 1-η 1:η 0-monodentate and the other one is μ 1-η 1:η 1-chelate. The Cd1-N bond distances are ranging from 2.328(5) to 2.450(5)Å with the N-Cd-N bond angles varying from 79.9(2) to 160.9(2). The Cd1-O bond distances are ranging from 2.313(5) to 2.631(7)Å with the O-Cd-O bond angles varying from 49.2(2) to 163.2(2) (). In 2 all three pyridine units of each DPBA-3 participate the coordination with Cd(II) atoms; while in 1 only two pyridine units in one DPBA-3 ligand take part in the coordination with the metal atoms. In 2 each DPBA-3 bridges three Cd(II) atoms to form a 2D structure (b). If both DPBA-3 ligand and Cd1 atom are considered as 3-connected nodes, the 2D layer can be simplified into a (6,3) net  as shown in Fig. S2a. The adjacent 2D layers are linked together by N-H⋯O hydrogen bonds between amide function groups and the nitrate anions to generate a 3D structure (Fig. S2b and ).

<ce:section-title>[Cd<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>(DPBA-3)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(SCN)<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>]·2DMF·4H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0060" view="all">When thiocyanate salt was introduced to the reaction with cadmium(II) nitrate and DPBA-3 ligand, complex <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> was isolated. There are two crystallographically different Cd(II) atoms, in which one is sitting on an inversion center, one DPBA-3, three thiocyanate anions, one non-coordinated DMF and two water molecules in the asymmetric unit of <ce:bold>3</ce:bold>. As shown in 
<ce:float-anchor refid="f0015"></ce:float-anchor>a, each Cd(II) atom is six-coordinated with distorted octahedral coordination geometry by two nitrogen atoms from two DPBA-3 ligands, two sulfur atoms from two thiocyanate anions and two nitrogen atoms from other two thiocyanate anions. The coordinating nitrogen atoms from DPBA-3 ligands occupy the apical positions of the octahedron and the other four coordinating atoms from the thiocyanate anions form the basal plane. In complex <ce:bold>3</ce:bold>, each DPBA-3 ligand coordinated to three Cd(II) atoms, leading to the formation of a 1D ladder chain structure along the <ce:italic>a</ce:italic> direction (Fig. S3). On the other hand, the thiocyanate anions in <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> adopt an end-to-end μ<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>-bridging mode, and link Cd(II) atoms together to form a doubly SCN<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup> bridged 1D chain structure, which is composed of eight-membered Cd<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(SCN)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> rings. The macrocycle constructed by two Cd1 and two SCN<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup> anions (S3 and S3A) shows stable chair conformation, and the centroid of this ring is the center of inversion. The macrocycle containing Cd1, Cd2 and two SCN<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup> anions (S1 and S2) has half-chair confirmation (b) since Cd2 and these two SCN<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup> are essentially coplanar with a deviation of 0.039 Å.</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
[Cd3(DPBA-3)2(SCN)6]⋅2DMF⋅4H2O (3)

When thiocyanate salt was introduced to the reaction with cadmium(II) nitrate and DPBA-3 ligand, complex 3 was isolated. There are two crystallographically different Cd(II) atoms, in which one is sitting on an inversion center, one DPBA-3, three thiocyanate anions, one non-coordinated DMF and two water molecules in the asymmetric unit of 3. As shown in  a, each Cd(II) atom is six-coordinated with distorted octahedral coordination geometry by two nitrogen atoms from two DPBA-3 ligands, two sulfur atoms from two thiocyanate anions and two nitrogen atoms from other two thiocyanate anions. The coordinating nitrogen atoms from DPBA-3 ligands occupy the apical positions of the octahedron and the other four coordinating atoms from the thiocyanate anions form the basal plane. In complex 3, each DPBA-3 ligand coordinated to three Cd(II) atoms, leading to the formation of a 1D ladder chain structure along the a direction (Fig. S3). On the other hand, the thiocyanate anions in 3 adopt an end-to-end μ2-bridging mode, and link Cd(II) atoms together to form a doubly SCN- bridged 1D chain structure, which is composed of eight-membered Cd2(SCN)2 rings. The macrocycle constructed by two Cd1 and two SCN- anions (S3 and S3A) shows stable chair conformation, and the centroid of this ring is the center of inversion. The macrocycle containing Cd1, Cd2 and two SCN- anions (S1 and S2) has half-chair confirmation (b) since Cd2 and these two SCN- are essentially coplanar with a deviation of 0.039 Å.

elements.content:
<ce:para id="p0065" view="all">The interconnection of these two types of 1D chains affords 3D framework of complex <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> (b). There are open channels filled by non-coordinated solvent molecules.</ce:para><ce:section-title>[Zn(DPBA-3)(SCN)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>4</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0070" view="all">The results of crystallographic analysis showed that complex <ce:bold>4</ce:bold> crystallizes in orthorhombic space group <ce:italic>P</ce:italic>2<ce:inf loc="post">1</ce:inf>2<ce:inf loc="post">1</ce:inf>2. The asymmetric unit of complex <ce:bold>4</ce:bold> contains one unique Zn(II), one DPBA-3 ligand and two thiocyanate anions. Each Zn(II) ion is tetrahedrally coordinated by two nitrogen atoms (N2, N2A) from two different DPBA-3 ligands, and two nitrogen atoms (N1, N1A) from two different SCN<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup> anions (
<ce:float-anchor refid="f0020"></ce:float-anchor>a). The average Zn1–N distance is 1.965<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å, and the coordination angles around Zn1 are ranging from 99.2(2)° to 120.7(2)° (). In complex <ce:bold>4</ce:bold> the DPBA-3 ligand shows the same coordination pattern as that appeared in <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>: only the terminal pyridine groups coordinated to the metal center and the central pyridine group is free of coordination. The zinc(II) centers are connected by DPBA-3 units to give an infinite 1D chain structure (Fig. S4a) along <ce:italic>a</ce:italic> direction, which is further linked by two C–H(pyridine)⋯O(amide) and one C–H(pyridine)⋯N(pyridine) hydrogen bonds to generate a 2D structure in <ce:italic>ac</ce:italic> plane (Fig. S4b). Such 2D layers are further held together by C–H(pyridine)⋯N(pyridine) and N–H(amide)⋯S hydrogen bonds to form 3D structure ( and b).</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
The interconnection of these two types of 1D chains affords 3D framework of complex 3 (b). There are open channels filled by non-coordinated solvent molecules.

[Zn(DPBA-3)(SCN)2] (4)

The results of crystallographic analysis showed that complex 4 crystallizes in orthorhombic space group P21212. The asymmetric unit of complex 4 contains one unique Zn(II), one DPBA-3 ligand and two thiocyanate anions. Each Zn(II) ion is tetrahedrally coordinated by two nitrogen atoms (N2, N2A) from two different DPBA-3 ligands, and two nitrogen atoms (N1, N1A) from two different SCN- anions ( a). The average Zn1-N distance is 1.965Å, and the coordination angles around Zn1 are ranging from 99.2(2)° to 120.7(2)° (). In complex 4 the DPBA-3 ligand shows the same coordination pattern as that appeared in 1: only the terminal pyridine groups coordinated to the metal center and the central pyridine group is free of coordination. The zinc(II) centers are connected by DPBA-3 units to give an infinite 1D chain structure (Fig. S4a) along a direction, which is further linked by two C-H(pyridine)⋯O(amide) and one C-H(pyridine)⋯N(pyridine) hydrogen bonds to generate a 2D structure in ac plane (Fig. S4b). Such 2D layers are further held together by C-H(pyridine)⋯N(pyridine) and N-H(amide)⋯S hydrogen bonds to form 3D structure ( and b).

elements.clean_text:
Luminescence properties of complexes 1-4 

Inorganic-organic hybrid coordination polymers, especially those with d 10 metal centers, have been investigated for fluorescence properties and for potential applications as fluorescence-emitting materials, such as light-emitting diodes (LEDs) . The luminescent behaviors of complexes 1-4 were studied at room temperature in the solid state. As shown in  , intense emission bands were observed at 421nm (λ ex =338nm) for DPBA-3, 422nm (λ ex =345nm) for 1, 431nm (λ ex =349nm) for 2, 437nm (λ ex =349nm) for 3, 437nm (λ ex =399nm) for 4, respectively. Compared to the DPBA-3 ligand, the emission bands of 1, 2, 3 and 4 are 1, 10, 16 and 16nm red shifted, respectively, which was considered to mainly originate from the influence of the coordination of metal atom to the ligand. The similar emissions between the ligand and the complexes are also probably contributed by the π-π∗ intraligand fluorescence .

elements.content: <ce:section-title>Conclusion</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0080" view="all">Four new coordination polymers have been prepared and structurally characterized. In complexes <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> and <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>, the metal ions are decorated by the terminal counterions and/or solvent molecules, which reduce the dimensionality of the coordination framework. In <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> doubly SCN<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup> bridged 1D inorganic polymeric chains are typically observed for Cd<ce:sup loc="post">2+</ce:sup> cations, which led to the formation of a 3D structure. Therefore the doubly bridging action of SCN<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup> with Cd<ce:sup loc="post">2+</ce:sup> ion can be used to design and prepare functional materials. Different from <ce:bold>3</ce:bold>, the SCN<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup> anion in <ce:bold>4</ce:bold> acts as a monodentate with N atom coordinated to the zinc(II) atom. These four compounds exhibit fluorescence emission bands in the solid state at room temperature, and they could be good candidates for photoactive materials.</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
Conclusion

Four new coordination polymers have been prepared and structurally characterized. In complexes 1 and 2, the metal ions are decorated by the terminal counterions and/or solvent molecules, which reduce the dimensionality of the coordination framework. In 3 doubly SCN- bridged 1D inorganic polymeric chains are typically observed for Cd2+ cations, which led to the formation of a 3D structure. Therefore the doubly bridging action of SCN- with Cd2+ ion can be used to design and prepare functional materials. Different from 3, the SCN- anion in 4 acts as a monodentate with N atom coordinated to the zinc(II) atom. These four compounds exhibit fluorescence emission bands in the solid state at room temperature, and they could be good candidates for photoactive materials.

cln_elements.clean_text:
Synthesis of the complexes

Preparation of [Cd(DPBA-3)2(H2O)2](ClO4)2⋅2H2O (1)

A mixture containing Cd(ClO4)2⋅6H2O (21mg, 0.05mmol), DPBA-3 (16mg, 0.05mmol), 10ml H2O and 1ml EtOH was sealed in a Teflon lined stainless steel container and heated at 85°C for 3days. After cooling to room temperature, the solution was filtered into the tube. After several days, colorless block crystals were obtained by the slow diffusion of diethyl ether into the reaction solution. Yield: 64%. Anal. Calc. for C34H34CdCl2N10O16: C, 39.96; H, 3.35; N, 13.71. Found: C, 40.02; H, 3.46; N, 13.81%. IR (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3418 (s), 1669 (s), 1673 (m), 1548 (m), 1484 (m), 1424 (m), 1335 (w), 1294 (m), 1246 (w), 1093 (s), 1026 (s), 953 (w), 807 (w), 706 (w), 626 (w).

Preparation of [Cd(DPBA-3)(DMF)(NO3)2]⋅DMF (2)

A solution containing DPBA-3 (16mg, 0.05mmol), 0.5ml THF and 4.5ml DMF was added to a DMF solution (5ml) of Cd(NO3)2⋅6H2O (18.6mg, 0.05mmol), and the solution was stirred for 10min, then filtered. The filtrate was diffused by diethyl ether for several days, during which time colorless crystals appeared. Yield: 72%. Anal. Calc. for C23H27CdN9O10: C, 39.36; H, 3.88; N, 17.96. Found: C, 39.39; H, 3.58; N, 13.97%. IR (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3253 (w), 1675 (s), 1548 (m), 1425 (s), 1355 (s), 1286 (m), 1191 (w), 1114 (m), 1026 (m), 923 (w), 834 (m), 732 (m), 700 (w), 677 (w), 636 (w).

Preparation of [Cd3(DPBA-3)2(SCN)6]⋅2DMF⋅4H2O (3)

The compound was prepared by layering method. A buffer layer of a THF/DMF 1:1 solution (5mL) containing NH4SCN (7.6mg, 0.1mmol) was carefully layered over a solution of DPBA-3 (16.0mg, 0.05mmol) in THF (3mL). Then a solution of Cd(ClO4)2⋅6H2O (20.9mg, 0.05mmol) in acetone (3mL) was layered over the buffer layer. Single crystals appeared after one week. Yield: 70%. Anal. Calc. for C46H48Cd3N18O10S6: C, 36.06; H, 3.21; N, 16.19. Found: C, 35.82; H, 3.14; N, 16.34%. IR (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3276 (m), 3061 (m), 2091 (s), 1657 (s), 1543 (s), 1482 (m), 1427 (s), 1386 (m), 1331 (m), 1292 (m), 1244 (m), 1128 (w), 1102 (w), 1058 (m), 923 (w), 840 (w), 806(m), 734 (w), 696 (s), 665 (m), 641 (m), 591 (m).

Preparation of [Zn(DPBA-3)(SCN)2] (4)

The complex was synthesized by the same method used for preparation of complex 1 except that Cd(ClO4)2⋅6H2O was replaced by Zn(ClO4)2⋅6H2O and NH4SCN was added. Yield: 66%. Anal. Calc. for C19H13N7O2S2Zn: C, 45.56; H, 2.62; N, 19.58. Found: C, 45.67; H, 2.68; N, 19.69%. IR (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3533 (m), 1701 (s), 1673 (m), 1606 (m), 1560 (s), 1438 (m), 1380 (s), 1329 (m), 1290 (m), 1212 (w), 846 (w), 784 (m), 770 (m), 696 (w), 596 (w).

<ce:section-title>Results and discussion</ce:section-title><ce:section-title>Description of the crystal structures of complexes <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>–<ce:bold>4</ce:bold>
</ce:section-title><ce:section-title>[Cd(DPBA-3)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>](ClO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0050" view="all">The results of crystallographic analysis revealed that the asymmetric unit of complex <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> consists of one Cd(II) ion located at a specific position, one DPBA-3 ligand, one coordinated and one non-coordinated water molecules, one perchlorate anion. As shown in 
<ce:float-anchor refid="f0005"></ce:float-anchor>a, the Cd(II) is six-coordinated with distorted octahedral coordination geometry by two oxygen atoms (O7, O7C) from two water molecules and four nitrogen atoms (N1A, N1B, N5, N5C) from four different DPBA-3 ligands. The Cd1-O distance is of 2.320(2)<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å and the Cd1–N ones are 2.352(3) and 2.357(3)<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å (). In <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> each terminal pyridine unit (N1 and N5) of the DPBA-3 ligand coordinated to one metal ion, while the central pyridine unit (N3) is free of coordination. Thus each DPBA-3 serves as a bi-dentate ligand. In complex <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> two Cd(II) and two DPBA-3 are connected together via the Cd-N coordination bonds to form an Cd<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(DPBA-3)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> macrocyclic ring with a Cd⋯Cd distance of 12.4269(48)<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å. Such macrocyclic rings are further linked together to give an infinite 1D chain structure along <ce:italic>c</ce:italic> direction (Fig. S1a), which is further linked by C2–H2⋯O2 hydrogen bond between the amide C<ce:glyph name="dbnd"></ce:glyph>O and the C–H from an adjacent pyridine end group to afford 2D network in <ce:italic>bc</ce:italic> plane (b). In the crystal packing diagram of complex <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>, such 2D networks are held together via hydrogen bonds to generate a 3D structure. The perchlorate anions are located in the cavities of the 3D framework (Fig. S1b). The hydrogen bonding data are summarized in 
<ce:float-anchor refid="t0015"></ce:float-anchor>.</ce:para><ce:para id="p0065" view="all">The interconnection of these two types of 1D chains affords 3D framework of complex <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> (b). There are open channels filled by non-coordinated solvent molecules.</ce:para><ce:section-title>[Zn(DPBA-3)(SCN)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>4</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0070" view="all">The results of crystallographic analysis showed that complex <ce:bold>4</ce:bold> crystallizes in orthorhombic space group <ce:italic>P</ce:italic>2<ce:inf loc="post">1</ce:inf>2<ce:inf loc="post">1</ce:inf>2. The asymmetric unit of complex <ce:bold>4</ce:bold> contains one unique Zn(II), one DPBA-3 ligand and two thiocyanate anions. Each Zn(II) ion is tetrahedrally coordinated by two nitrogen atoms (N2, N2A) from two different DPBA-3 ligands, and two nitrogen atoms (N1, N1A) from two different SCN<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup> anions (
<ce:float-anchor refid="f0020"></ce:float-anchor>a). The average Zn1–N distance is 1.965<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å, and the coordination angles around Zn1 are ranging from 99.2(2)° to 120.7(2)° (). In complex <ce:bold>4</ce:bold> the DPBA-3 ligand shows the same coordination pattern as that appeared in <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>: only the terminal pyridine groups coordinated to the metal center and the central pyridine group is free of coordination. The zinc(II) centers are connected by DPBA-3 units to give an infinite 1D chain structure (Fig. S4a) along <ce:italic>a</ce:italic> direction, which is further linked by two C–H(pyridine)⋯O(amide) and one C–H(pyridine)⋯N(pyridine) hydrogen bonds to generate a 2D structure in <ce:italic>ac</ce:italic> plane (Fig. S4b). Such 2D layers are further held together by C–H(pyridine)⋯N(pyridine) and N–H(amide)⋯S hydrogen bonds to form 3D structure ( and b).</ce:para><ce:section-title>Luminescence properties of complexes <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>–<ce:bold>4</ce:bold>
</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0075" view="all">Inorganic-organic hybrid coordination polymers, especially those with <ce:italic>d</ce:italic>
<ce:sup loc="post">10</ce:sup> metal centers, have been investigated for fluorescence properties and for potential applications as fluorescence-emitting materials, such as light-emitting diodes (LEDs) . The luminescent behaviors of complexes <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>–<ce:bold>4</ce:bold> were studied at room temperature in the solid state. As shown in 
<ce:float-anchor refid="f0025"></ce:float-anchor>, intense emission bands were observed at 421<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>nm (<ce:italic>λ</ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">ex</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>338<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>nm) for DPBA-3, 422<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>nm (<ce:italic>λ</ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">ex</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>345<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>nm) for <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>, 431<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>nm (<ce:italic>λ</ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">ex</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>349<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>nm) for <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>, 437<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>nm (<ce:italic>λ</ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">ex</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>349<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>nm) for <ce:bold>3</ce:bold>, 437<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>nm (<ce:italic>λ</ce:italic>

cln_elements.clean_text:
Results and discussion

Description of the crystal structures of complexes 1-4 

[Cd(DPBA-3)2(H2O)2](ClO4)2⋅2H2O (1)

The results of crystallographic analysis revealed that the asymmetric unit of complex 1 consists of one Cd(II) ion located at a specific position, one DPBA-3 ligand, one coordinated and one non-coordinated water molecules, one perchlorate anion. As shown in  a, the Cd(II) is six-coordinated with distorted octahedral coordination geometry by two oxygen atoms (O7, O7C) from two water molecules and four nitrogen atoms (N1A, N1B, N5, N5C) from four different DPBA-3 ligands. The Cd1-O distance is of 2.320(2)Å and the Cd1-N ones are 2.352(3) and 2.357(3)Å (). In 1 each terminal pyridine unit (N1 and N5) of the DPBA-3 ligand coordinated to one metal ion, while the central pyridine unit (N3) is free of coordination. Thus each DPBA-3 serves as a bi-dentate ligand. In complex 1 two Cd(II) and two DPBA-3 are connected together via the Cd-N coordination bonds to form an Cd2(DPBA-3)2 macrocyclic ring with a Cd⋯Cd distance of 12.4269(48)Å. Such macrocyclic rings are further linked together to give an infinite 1D chain structure along c direction (Fig. S1a), which is further linked by C2-H2⋯O2 hydrogen bond between the amide CO and the C-H from an adjacent pyridine end group to afford 2D network in bc plane (b). In the crystal packing diagram of complex 1, such 2D networks are held together via hydrogen bonds to generate a 3D structure. The perchlorate anions are located in the cavities of the 3D framework (Fig. S1b). The hydrogen bonding data are summarized in  .

The interconnection of these two types of 1D chains affords 3D framework of complex 3 (b). There are open channels filled by non-coordinated solvent molecules.

[Zn(DPBA-3)(SCN)2] (4)

The results of crystallographic analysis showed that complex 4 crystallizes in orthorhombic space group P21212. The asymmetric unit of complex 4 contains one unique Zn(II), one DPBA-3 ligand and two thiocyanate anions. Each Zn(II) ion is tetrahedrally coordinated by two nitrogen atoms (N2, N2A) from two different DPBA-3 ligands, and two nitrogen atoms (N1, N1A) from two different SCN- anions ( a). The average Zn1-N distance is 1.965Å, and the coordination angles around Zn1 are ranging from 99.2(2)° to 120.7(2)° (). In complex 4 the DPBA-3 ligand shows the same coordination pattern as that appeared in 1: only the terminal pyridine groups coordinated to the metal center and the central pyridine group is free of coordination. The zinc(II) centers are connected by DPBA-3 units to give an infinite 1D chain structure (Fig. S4a) along a direction, which is further linked by two C-H(pyridine)⋯O(amide) and one C-H(pyridine)⋯N(pyridine) hydrogen bonds to generate a 2D structure in ac plane (Fig. S4b). Such 2D layers are further held together by C-H(pyridine)⋯N(pyridine) and N-H(amide)⋯S hydrogen bonds to form 3D structure ( and b).

Luminescence properties of complexes 1-4 

Inorganic-organic hybrid coordination polymers, especially those with d 10 metal centers, have been investigated for fluorescence properties and for potential applications as fluorescence-emitting materials, such as light-emitting diodes (LEDs) . The luminescent behaviors of complexes 1-4 were studied at room temperature in the solid state. As shown in  , intense emission bands were observed at 421nm (λ ex =338nm) for DPBA-3, 422nm (λ ex =345nm) for 1, 431nm (λ ex =349nm) for 2, 437nm (λ ex =349nm) for 3, 437nm (λ ex =399nm) for 4, respectively. Compared to the DPBA-3 ligand, the emission bands of 1, 2, 3 and 4 are 1, 10, 16 and 16nm red shifted, respectively, which was considered to mainly originate from the influence of the coordination of metal atom to the ligand. The similar emissions between the ligand and the complexes are also probably contributed by the π-π∗ intraligand fluorescence .
